title: Customizing Plots
text: üá¨üáß Dendrograms can customized, using argument available plot() function. following example, multiple aspects figure modified, including labels, axes colors. üá™üá∏ Los dendrogramas pueden ser personalizados, utilizando cualquier argumento disponible para la funci√≥n plot(). En el siguiente ejemplo, se modifican diversos aspectos de la figura, incluyendo etiquetas, ejes y colores.
code: library(ClustMC)  data(clover)  bss_test(   y = clover$nitrogen, trt = clover$treatment, console = FALSE,   main = "A customized plot", xlab = "Treatments", ylab = NULL, col = "grey50",   cex = 0.75, axes = FALSE, frame.plot = TRUE )

title: Customizing Plots
text: üá¨üáß Straight lines created abline() function appearance can also customized. case, list() must passed argument. list contain desired arguments values abline(). example provided : üá™üá∏ Las l√≠neas rectas son creadas con la funci√≥n abline() y su apariencia tambi√©n puede ser personalizada. En este caso, se deber√° proveer como argumento un objeto de tipo list(). Este objeto debe contener los argumentos y valores deseados para abline(). continuaci√≥n se muestra un ejemplo:
code: library(ClustMC)  data(PlantGrowth) plants_weights <- PlantGrowth$weight plants_trt <- PlantGrowth$group  dgc_test(   y = plants_weights, trt = plants_trt, console = FALSE,   main = "A plot with a customized line",   abline_options = list(col = "red", lty = 3, lwd = 1) )

title: Customizing Plots
text: üá¨üáß Alternatively, hclust object, functions use create dendrogram, provided user, enabling use different libraries. following example, ggdendro package used plot dendrogram ggplot2. üá™üá∏ Como alternativa, el usuario tiene acceso al objeto de clase hclust usado por las funciones para crear el dendrograma, lo cual permite la aplicaci√≥n de diversos paquetes. En el siguiente ejemplo se recurre al paquete ggdendro para graficar el dendrograma con ggplot2.
code: library(ClustMC) library(ggplot2) library(ggdendro)  data(bread) anova_model <- aov(volume ~ variety + as.factor(bromate), data = bread)  test_results <- jolliffe_test(   y = anova_model, trt = "variety", console = FALSE,   show_plot = FALSE )  ggdendro::ggdendrogram(test_results$dendrogram_data) +   ggplot2::geom_hline(     yintercept = 0.95, colour = "blue", linetype = "dotted",     linewidth = 0.75   ) +   ggplot2::ggtitle("SLCA dendrogram for bread baking data")

title: Cluster-Based Multiple Comparisons
text: üá¨üáß ClustMC implements cluster-based multiple comparisons tests. tests apply clustering techniques group means different treatments non-overlapping clusters, treatments considered statistically different separate groups. tests included package share similar features: Inspired agricolae package, possible work either two vectors (one response variable one treatments) model (created lm() aov()). latter case, name variable treatments must specified. applying corresponding method, table containing treatments group (indicated number) printed console. Treatments within group significantly different. user can choose display table. default, dendrogram plotted. dendrogram can customized argument passed plot() function. addition, data used create plot made available user, possible use libraries ggplot2. üá™üá∏ ClustMC implementa pruebas de comparaciones m√∫ltiples basadas en conglomerados. Estas pruebas aplican t√©cnicas de clustering para agrupar las medias de los distintos tratamientos en conglomerados superpuestos, consider√°ndose los tratamientos estad√≠sticamente diferentes si se encuentran en grupos separados. Todos los tests incluidos en el paquete tienen caracter√≠sticas similares: Bas√°ndose en el paquete agricolae, es posible trabajar con dos vectores (uno para la variable respuesta y otro para los tratamientos) o con un modelo (creado con lm() o aov()). En el segundo caso, se debe indicar el nombre de la variable con los tratamientos comparar. Luego de aplicar el m√©todo correspondiente, se imprime en la consola una tabla con los tratamientos y el grupo al que han sido asignados (indicado por un n√∫mero). Los tratamientos dentro del mismo grupo son significativamente diferentes. Se puede optar por mostrar estos resultados. Por defecto, se grafica un dendrograma. El dendrograma puede ser personalizado con cualquier argumento de la funci√≥n plot(). Adem√°s, el usuario tiene acceso los datos usados para crearlo, por lo que es posible recurrir otros paquetes como ggplot2.

title: Cluster-Based Multiple Comparisons
text: package can installed CRAN: / El paquete puede instalarse desde CRAN: development version available GitHub: / La versi√≥n en desarrollo est√° disponible en GitHub:

title: Cluster-Based Multiple Comparisons
text: üá¨üáß following example applies Di Rienzo, Guzm√°n, Casanoves test evaluate whether significant differences yields obtained control two different treatment conditions. case, vectors passed arguments. üá™üá∏ El siguiente ejemplo aplica la prueba de Di Rienzo, Guzm√°n y Casanoves para evaluar si existen diferencias significativas entre los rendimientos obtenidos bajo una condici√≥n de control y dos condiciones de tratamiento diferentes. En este caso, se pasan vectores como argumentos.  üá¨üáß following example, dataset results bread-baking experiment used. ANOVA model fitted, volume loaves response variable amount potassium bromate variety wheat explanatory variables. Jolliffe test applied evaluate differences 17 varieties. üá™üá∏ En el siguiente ejemplo, se utiliza un dataset con los resultados de un experimento de panader√≠a. Se ajusta un modelo ANOVA con el volumen de los panes como variable respuesta y la cantidad de bromato de potasio y la variedad de trigo como variables explicativas. La prueba de Jolliffe se aplica luego para evaluar las diferencias entre las 17 variedades.
code: library(ClustMC)  data(PlantGrowth) plants_weights <- PlantGrowth$weight plants_trt <- PlantGrowth$group  dgc_test(y = plants_weights, trt = plants_trt) #>      group #> ctrl     1 #> trt1     1 #> trt2     2 #> Treatments within the same group are not significantly different library(ClustMC)  data(bread) anova_model <- aov(volume ~ variety + as.factor(bromate), data = bread)  jolliffe_test(y = anova_model, trt = "variety") #>   group #> M     1 #> P     2 #> D     2 #> C     2 #> Q     2 #> L     2 #> H     2 #> G     2 #> N     2 #> B     2 #> F     2 #> I     2 #> K     2 #> J     2 #> E     2 #> A     2 #> O     2 #> Treatments within the same group are not significantly different

title: Cluster-Based Multiple Comparisons
text: üá¨üáß Dendrograms can customized, using argument available plot() function. case lines, arguments abline() function must passed list. detailed explanation examples, check vignette("CustomPlots"). üá™üá∏ Los dendrogramas pueden ser personalizados, utilizando cualquier argumento disponible para la funci√≥n plot(). En el caso de las l√≠neas rectas, se debe utilizar una lista conteniendo argumentos para la funci√≥n abline(). Para ver una explicaci√≥n detallada y ejemplos, revise vignette("CustomPlots").

title: ClustMC: Cluster-Based Multiple Comparisons ‚Äî ClustMC-package
text: Multiple comparison techniques typically applied following F test ANOVA decide means significantly different one another. alternative traditional methods, cluster analysis can performed group means different treatments non-overlapping clusters. Treatments different groups considered statistically different. Several approaches proposed, varying clustering methods cut-criteria. package implements cluster-based multiple comparisons tests also provides visual representation form dendrogram. Di Rienzo, J. ., Guzman, . W., & Casanoves, F. (2002) <jstor.org/stable/1400690>. Bautista, M. G., Smith, D. W., & Steiner, R. L. (1997) doi:10.2307/1400402 .

title: ClustMC: Cluster-Based Multiple Comparisons ‚Äî ClustMC-package
text: Maintainer: Santiago Garcia Sanchez santiagoesquel@gmail.com [copyright holder]

what: Bautista, Smith and Steiner test for multiple comparisons ‚Äî bss_test
title: Bautista, Smith and Steiner test for multiple comparisons ‚Äî bss_test
text: Bautista, Smith Steiner (BSS) test multiple comparisons. Implements procedure grouping treatments following determination differences among . First, cluster analysis treatment means performed two closest means grouped. nested analysis variance original ANOVA constructed treatment source now partitioned "groups" "treatments within groups". process repeated differences among group means differences among treatments within groups.

title: Bautista, Smith and Steiner test for multiple comparisons ‚Äî bss_test
code: bss_test(   y,   trt,   alpha = 0.05,   show_plot = TRUE,   console = TRUE,   abline_options,   ... )

title: Bautista, Smith and Steiner test for multiple comparisons ‚Äî bss_test
text: y Either model (created lm() aov()) numerical vector values response variable unit. trt y model, string name column containing treatments. y vector, vector length y treatments unit. alpha Numeric value corresponding significance level test. default value 0.05. show_plot Logical value indicating whether constructed dendrogram plotted . console Logical value indicating whether results printed console . abline_options list optional arguments line dendrogram. ... Optional arguments plot() function.

title: Bautista, Smith and Steiner test for multiple comparisons ‚Äî bss_test

title: Bautista, Smith and Steiner test for multiple comparisons ‚Äî bss_test
text: Santiago Garcia Sanchez

title: Bautista, Smith and Steiner test for multiple comparisons ‚Äî bss_test
code: data("PlantGrowth") # Using vectors ------------------------------------------------------- weights <- PlantGrowth$weight treatments <- PlantGrowth$group bss_test(y = weights, trt = treatments, show_plot = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 3 √ó 2 #>   treatment group #>   <fct>     <dbl> #> 1 trt1          1 #> 2 ctrl          1 #> 3 trt2          2 #> Treatments within the same group are not significantly different # Using a model ------------------------------------------------------- model <- lm(weights ~ treatments) bss_test(y = model, trt = "treatments", show_plot = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 3 √ó 2 #>   treatment group #>   <fct>     <dbl> #> 1 trt1          1 #> 2 ctrl          1 #> 3 trt2          2 #> Treatments within the same group are not significantly different

what: Di Rienzo, Guzman and Casanoves test for multiple comparisons ‚Äî dgc_test
title: Di Rienzo, Guzman and Casanoves test for multiple comparisons ‚Äî dgc_test
text: Di Rienzo, Guzman Casanoves (DGC) test multiple comparisons. Implements cluster-based method identifying groups nonhomogeneous means. Average linkage clustering applied distance matrix obtained sample means. distribution \(Q\) (distance source root node tree) used build test significance level \(\alpha\). Groups whose means join \(c\) (\(\alpha\)-level cut-criterion) statistically different.

title: Di Rienzo, Guzman and Casanoves test for multiple comparisons ‚Äî dgc_test
code: dgc_test(   y,   trt,   alpha = 0.05,   show_plot = TRUE,   console = TRUE,   abline_options,   ... )

title: Di Rienzo, Guzman and Casanoves test for multiple comparisons ‚Äî dgc_test
text: y Either model (created lm() aov()) numerical vector values response variable unit. trt y model, string name column containing treatments. y vector, vector length y treatments unit. alpha Value equivalent 0.05 0.01, corresponding significance level test. default value 0.05. show_plot Logical value indicating whether constructed dendrogram plotted . console Logical value indicating whether results printed console . abline_options list optional arguments line dendrogram. ... Optional arguments plot() function.

title: Di Rienzo, Guzman and Casanoves test for multiple comparisons ‚Äî dgc_test
text: list three data.frame one hclust: stats data.frame containing summary statistics treatment. groups data.frame indicating group treatment assigned. parameters data.frame values used test. treatments total number treatments, alpha significance level used, c cut-criterion dendrogram (height horizontal line dendrogram), q \(1 - \alpha\) quantile distribution \(Q\) (distance root node) null hypothesis SEM estimate standard error mean. dendrogram_data object class hclust data used build dendrogram.

title: Di Rienzo, Guzman and Casanoves test for multiple comparisons ‚Äî dgc_test
text: Di Rienzo, J. ., Guzman, . W., & Casanoves, F. (2002). Multiple-Comparisons Method Based Distribution Root Node Distance Binary Tree. Journal Agricultural, Biological, Environmental Statistics, 7(2), 129-142. <jstor.org/stable/1400690>

title: Di Rienzo, Guzman and Casanoves test for multiple comparisons ‚Äî dgc_test
text: Santiago Garcia Sanchez

title: Di Rienzo, Guzman and Casanoves test for multiple comparisons ‚Äî dgc_test
code: data("PlantGrowth") # Using vectors ------------------------------------------------------- weights <- PlantGrowth$weight treatments <- PlantGrowth$group dgc_test(y = weights, trt = treatments, show_plot = FALSE) #>      group #> ctrl     1 #> trt1     1 #> trt2     2 #> Treatments within the same group are not significantly different # Using a model ------------------------------------------------------- model <- lm(weights ~ treatments) dgc_test(y = model, trt = "treatments", show_plot = FALSE) #>      group #> ctrl     1 #> trt1     1 #> trt2     2 #> Treatments within the same group are not significantly different

what: Jolliffe test for multiple comparisons ‚Äî jolliffe_test
title: Jolliffe test for multiple comparisons ‚Äî jolliffe_test
text: .T. Jolliffe test multiple comparisons. Implements cluster-based alternative closely linked Student-Newman-Keuls multiple comparison method. Single-linkage cluster analysis applied, using p-values obtained SNK test pairwise mean comparison similarity measure. Groups whose means join beyond \(1 - \alpha\) statistically different. Alternatively, complete linkage cluster analysis can also applied.

title: Jolliffe test for multiple comparisons ‚Äî jolliffe_test
code: jolliffe_test(   y,   trt,   alpha = 0.05,   method = "single",   show_plot = TRUE,   console = TRUE,   abline_options,   ... )

title: Jolliffe test for multiple comparisons ‚Äî jolliffe_test
text: y Either model (created lm() aov()) numerical vector values response variable unit. trt y model, string name column containing treatments. y vector, vector length y treatments unit. alpha Numeric value corresponding significance level test. default value 0.05. method string indicating clustering method used. single linkage (default method) either "single" "slca". complete linkage, either "complete" "clca". show_plot Logical value indicating whether constructed dendrogram plotted . console Logical value indicating whether results printed console . abline_options list optional arguments line dendrogram. ... Optional arguments plot() function.

title: Jolliffe test for multiple comparisons ‚Äî jolliffe_test
text: list three data.frame one hclust: stats data.frame containing summary statistics treatment. groups data.frame indicating group treatment assigned. parameters data.frame values used test. treatments total number treatments, alpha significance level used, n either number repetitions treatments harmonic mean said repetitions, MSE mean standard error ANOVA table SEM estimate standard error mean. dendrogram_data object class hclust data used build dendrogram.

title: Jolliffe test for multiple comparisons ‚Äî jolliffe_test
text: Jolliffe, . T. (1975). Cluster analysis multiple comparison method. Applied Statistics: Proceedings Conference Dalhousie University, Halifax, 159-168.

title: Jolliffe test for multiple comparisons ‚Äî jolliffe_test
text: Santiago Garcia Sanchez

title: Jolliffe test for multiple comparisons ‚Äî jolliffe_test
code: data("PlantGrowth") # Using vectors ------------------------------------------------------- weights <- PlantGrowth$weight treatments <- PlantGrowth$group jolliffe_test(y = weights, trt = treatments, alpha = 0.1, show_plot = FALSE) #>      group #> trt1     1 #> ctrl     1 #> trt2     2 #> Treatments within the same group are not significantly different # Using a model ------------------------------------------------------- model <- lm(weights ~ treatments) jolliffe_test(y = model, trt = "treatments", alpha = 0.1, show_plot = FALSE) #>      group #> trt1     1 #> ctrl     1 #> trt2     2 #> Treatments within the same group are not significantly different
